intro: Chaetaria capensis, commonly known as the Cape chaetaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
